On the 1st September 2020 the Brunei government announced in a joint press statement with the Singapore government that an agreement had been made with Singapore to establish a âreciprocal green laneâ for essential business and official travel. Leisure travel is not applicable in the current green lane arrangement between both countries.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200903081944/http://mfa.gov.bn/Shared%20Documents/Annex.pdf

According to the press conference of the Ministry of Education, so far, 31 provinces (autonomous regions, municipalities) and the Xinjiang Production and Construction Corps have clarified the arrangements for the start of the fall semester, carried out in different phases. Elementary and secondary schools, kindergarten institutions and colleges and universities in various places arrange to start school from August 15th to October 10th. Colleges and universities are scheduled to start school from the end of August to September or early October.   The start of the fall semester of primary and secondary schools and kindergartens in the Xinjiang Uygur Autonomous Region has been postponed, and online teaching will be launched from September 1.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200827222545/http://www.gov.cn/xinwen/2020-08/27/content_5538052.htm

The Urumqi City Epidemic Prevention and Control Headquarters decided to gradually adjust the prevention and control policies of some COVID-free residential areas from August 23. The three main criteria to define a COVID-free residential area are: 1. there are no confirmed new cases, asymptomatic infections, and suspected cases. 2. all residents in the community were negative in the latest tests. 3. the area has high management standards and high-quality services. Residential areas in 6 districts are identified including all communities in the three districts (counties) of Dabancheng District, Urumqi County, and Ganquanbao Economic and Technological Development Zone and Midong District, Economic Development Zone (Toutunhe District), High-tech Zone (new urban area), Shayibake District, Shuimo.  Supermarkets, convenience stores, fruit and vegetable shops, etc., that provide residents with daily necessities in the small area can resume business to individual residents of the community within the specified time while doing epidemic prevention work.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200827224441/http://www.xj.gov.cn/info/10701/70013.htm

The Urumqi City Epidemic Prevention and Control Headquarters decided to gradually adjust the prevention and control policies of some COVID-free residential areas from August 23.   Community residents of these areas can conduct non-aggregated personal activities in the residential area. Residents must take good personal protection, wear masks, keep a certain distance from others, public gathering and events are not allowed.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200827224441/http://www.xj.gov.cn/info/10701/70013.htm

The Urumqi City Epidemic Prevention and Control Headquarters decided to gradually adjust the prevention and control policies of some COVID-free residential areas from August 23, 2020.   Community residents of these areas can conduct non-aggregated personal activities in the residential area. Residents must take good personal protection, wear masks, keep a certain distance from others, public gathering is not allowed.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200827224441/http://www.xj.gov.cn/info/10701/70013.htm

The Urumqi City Epidemic Prevention and Control Headquarters decided to gradually adjust the prevention and control policies of some COVID-free residential areas from August 23.   Only residents of these areas can conduct non-aggregated personal activities in the residential area. Residents must take good personal protection, wear masks, keep a certain distance from others, public gathering is not allowed.  The three main criteria to define a COVID-free residential area are: 1. there are no confirmed new cases, asymptomatic infections, and suspected cases. 2. all residents in the community were negative in the latest tests. 3. the area has high management standards and high-quality services. Residential areas in 6 districts are identified including all communities in the three districts (counties) of Dabancheng District, Urumqi County, and Ganquanbao Economic and Technological Development Zone and Midong District, Economic Development Zone (Toutunhe District), High-tech Zone (new urban area), Shayibake District, Shuimo.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200827224441/http://www.xj.gov.cn/info/10701/70013.htm

In a statement by the Ministry of Health, from 25th August 2020: houses of worship, restaurants, cafes, entertainment venues, such as gaming centres, bars, pubs and conferences and meeting venues, swimming pools, common areas in boarding facilities, including weddings, funerals and other community gatherings can now function at 50% capacity.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200831153129/http://www.health.gov.fj/statement-by-ps-health-on-border-case-and-covid-safe-amendments/

As of 25th August 2020, gatherings (which were limited to 100 people) will now be increased to 250 people.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200831153129/http://www.health.gov.fj/statement-by-ps-health-on-border-case-and-covid-safe-amendments/

Given that travellers appear to be able to enter again, I would place this under a 2 rather a 3:  "Undergo a COVID-19 test upon arrival and wait in official facilities/designated hotels to receive laboratory results.? In the event one or more travelers on an arriving vessel/flight test positive, all passengers must undergo a 14-day quarantine at a location designated by Cambodian authorities. ?Health authorities will then oversee another COVID-19 test on the 13th day of quarantine.? If all travelers test negative, health authorities will require travelers to self-isolate for 14-days at their home or lodging."  https://kh.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Schools in Lao re-opened in June 2020  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.unicef.org/laos/stories/safely-back-school
Most workplaces are open, however entertainment venues remain closed.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Large gatherings including weddings and traditional ceremonies are now allowed. However, entertainment venues remain closed. Sporting venues are open but must adhere to strict social distancing and hygiene measures.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

There are no restrictions on gatherings as large gatherings are now allowed. These can be religious or cultural celebrations and sporting activities.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
All public transport is allowed to operate throughout the country  https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

This is not a requirement as public gatherings are allowed and most markets and social events are allowed to take place  https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

There are no restrictions on internal movement. In country movement and all public transport is fully operational  https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

ith the exception of certain checkpoints allowed by the government, border checkpoints for individuals and transportation of goods, will remain closed as will all international borders. However, foreign businessmen, investors, workers for large investment projects as well as diplomats and foreign experts with proper medical certification and authorization can enter the country but must be quarantined for 14   https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

The Government agreed to compensate 60% of salaries of people who participate in the social security scheme and had their work terminated from May 2020.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

A new credit policy is enacted to provide and restructure loan facilities to financial institutions and businesses that were affected by the pandemic  https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193237/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
There is a coordinated public information campaign to inform people of new policies and updates.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200907193342/https://www.unicef.org/laos/stories/safely-back-school

The WHO report shows that the testing capacity is enhanced. Tests are being conducted everyday and there are no reports of laboratory or case reporting backlogs.   https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.who.int/laos/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-situation-report-for-lao-pdr-12-21---27-august-2020

The WHO report shows that contact tracing is being done for all cases. All cases are traced, monitored and tested. All contacts are monitored to complete 14 days of quarantine  https://web.archive.org/save/https://www.who.int/laos/internal-publications-detail/covid-19-situation-report-for-lao-pdr-12-21---27-august-2020

The government of Myanmar ordered all schools, including private ones, to close from 26 August. The date for re-opening has not yet been announced  https://web.archive.org/web/20200909015440/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/myanmar/coronavirus

The Senior Minister (Security Cluster), Datuk Seri Ismail Sabri Yaakob, announced the enforcement of the administrative EMCO in Amanjaya, effective since August 26 until a date to be announced. He also added that residents were not allowed to leave, while outsiders were not allowed to enter the three zones even for work purposes. Roadblocks will also be set up, by the Royal Malaysia Police and the Malaysian Armed Forces, to monitor movements.     Source: https://www.malaymail.com/news/malaysia/2020/08/29/emco-more-than-3200-amanjaya-residents-screened-says-kedah-health-director/1898359  (unable to archive)

On July 23, Senior Defence Minister, Ismail Sabri Yaakob, announced that "The government has made it compulsory, effective August 1, to wear face masks inside public transportation (...) those who flout the mandatory mask rule can be subject to prosecution under the Prevention and Control of Infectious Diseases Act 1988 that provide for a fine of up to RM1,000, close to the minimum monthly wage of RM1,100 or RM1,200."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200829101753/https://codeblue.galencentre.org/2020/07/23/starting-aug-1-masks-mandatory-in-public-areas-with-rm1000-fine/

"Only nightclubs and entertainment centers remain shut (...)"    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200829082827/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/global-health/science-and-disease/coronavirus-news-lockdown-covid-uk-rules-work-cases-deaths/

All sporting activities are allowed in case they occur without the presence of spectators or overseas participants, however, international sporting events are still prohibited.    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200829100750/https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/malaysia-recovery-movement-control-order-extended-dec-31-mco-13047724  http://web.archive.org/web/20200829082827/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/global-health/science-and-disease/coronavirus-news-lockdown-covid-uk-rules-work-cases-deaths/

"Malaysia has extended its pandemic movement restrictions including a ban on foreign tourists until the end of the year (...)"    "For now, Malaysia is not ready to open our borders to foreign tourists. Even between Malaysia and Singapore, we only allow people from two categories (to travel), including our citizens who had been stranded in Singapore. The other category is for those (from Singapore) who are permitted to enter Malaysia for business-to-business purposes, such as attending meetings in Kuala Lumpur."    SourceS: http://web.archive.org/web/20200829082827/https://www.telegraph.co.uk/global-health/science-and-disease/coronavirus-news-lockdown-covid-uk-rules-work-cases-deaths/  http://web.archive.org/web/20200831164550/https://www.ttgasia.com/2020/08/31/malaysia-extends-recovery-mco-to-year-end-ban-on-foreign-tourists-remain/

On Monday August 31, Malaysia marked the 63rd anniversary of its independence (...) with a scaled back celebration due to the restrictive measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak. No assemblies and parades by uniformed bodies, government agencies and private sector were held due to COVID-19 restrictions. Instead, small official celebrating events were held in several venues in Putrajaya and the capital city of Kuala Lumpur, which were broadcasted live to the Malaysians."    Note: I coded this indicator as 2G because even though events like this one can go ahead, some are still prohibited (e.g. international sporting events).    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200831162531/https://nation.com.pk/31-Aug-2020/malaysia-celebrates-63rd-anniversary-of-independence?show=preview

On Monday August 31, Malaysia marked the 63rd anniversary of its independence (...) with a scaled back celebration due to the restrictive measures to contain the COVID-19 outbreak. As of August 6th, financial service providers are allowed to operate at full operational capacity and employees of such providers are allowed full mobility in performance of their functions.    See the updated resolution, archived: http://archive.vn/AkVX3

No change in policy observed. 'The National Capital Region (Metro Manila), Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna and Rizal are subject to General Community Quarantine (GCQ) measures from 19 August. ' http://archive.fo/Ua86M. Under GCQ public transport is allowed with strict social distancing

GCQ policy in place. 'The National Capital Region (Metro Manila), Bulacan, Cavite, Laguna and Rizal are subject to General Community Quarantine (GCQ) measures from 19 August. ' http://archive.fo/Ua86M

"Due to the evolving COVID-19 situation, PAL and the Philippine Government have issued precautionary measures, mandatory protocols and requirements for travelers. For passengers in international flights to the Philippines, please be guided on new arrival and quarantine procedures in Manila, Cebu, and Clark."  "AT THE QUARANTINE HOTEL        16. Check in at your hotel and wait for the release of your test results, which are released in 24-48 hours. For those who tested negative, it will be sent to the e-mail address you have provided when you registered. If you filled out a Philippine mobile number during registration, you will also receive a text message (SMS) indicating that your test result is ready and has been sent to the e-mail address you have provided when you registered. The timings on release of test results are not definite and may be shortened or extended.       In case you have onward connecting flights and are required to extend your stay, please call +632 8855-8888 as soon as possible for the rebooking of your connecting flights (subject to terms and conditions).      17. Your accommodation and food during your stay including fees due to required extensions will be at your own expense. Delivery of food and other essentials to your room are subject to the rules and regulations of the hotel.             GOING HOME        18. If you test positive, the BOQ shall transfer you to a designated hospital for further medical management.               If you test negative, you may obtain your BOQ medical certificate via the DOH-BOQ certificate page for clearance at your quarantine hotel. For a hard copy of your certificate, printing services will be available at your hotel.      19. Once you are cleared, you may contact your relatives to pick you up and bring you home. Further transportation shall be at your own expense. If you have an onward PAL flight, please ensure to pre-register and secure all travel and health documents required by your destinationâs Local Government Unit (LGU). Click here for more information.       20. Once at home, please complete your 14-day quarantine/self-isolation."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200903033414/https://www.philippineairlines.com/en/ph/home/covid-19/arrivingintheph
No new income support measures found and the one introduced in April is long gone. The one-off payment of 5000/8000 PHP to poor families was meant to last for the months of April and May.
Regular briefings by the ministry https://www.covid19.gov.ph/ + news on government's reponses here: https://pcoo.gov.ph/news-releases

Testing is available for anyone symptomatic. However, there is ongoing debate on the under-performance of COVID19 testings.    http://web.archive.org/web/20200907174113/https://blogs.bmj.com/covid-19/2020/08/26/covid-19-testing-in-the-philippines-enhancing-testing-productivity/

Students in IHLs will continue to return primarily for practical and lab sessions, with a maximum of 50 persons per class. Similarly, other classes or consultations that were previously conducted online can now gradually resume on campus, with no more than 50 persons (including the lecturer/tutor) per class. All large-scale classes and lectures will continue to be held online. https://web.archive.org/web/20200902003301/https://www.moe.gov.sg/faqs-covid-19-infection

Related policy: on the 24th August 2020 the Taiwan Ministry of Education announced that "Chinese students, both new and those currently enrolled in tertiary-level schools in Taiwan, will be allowed to enter the country with immediate effect." According to the Ministry of Education, "roughly 10,000 international students, of which 5,000 are from China, are expected to apply for entry to Taiwan amid the COVID-19 pandemic."     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20200903085847/https://focustaiwan.tw/society/202008240026

Schools have remained open. Unesco lists Vanuatu schools as open in their interactive map.  No additional information available on government and health ministry web pages. Ministry of Education & Training Facebook updates indicate normal operation.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200828085148/https://covid19.gov.vu/index.php/updates/press-releases   https://web.archive.org/save/https://apa.sdg4education2030.org/covid19
No measures.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200828083359/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/vanuatu/coronavirus

A State of Emergency is in place in Vanuatu until 31 December 2020, in response to the Covid-19 pandemic. There are no restrictions in place on social gatherings. Restaurants, bars and supermarkets are permitted to open as usual, although some are operating a restricted service or have closed altogether in response to falling trade.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200828083359/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/vanuatu/coronavirus

Borders remain closed with no commercial flights entering or leaving Vanuatu. Tourism website indicates all ports of entry remain closed.      https://web.archive.org/web/20200828082948/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/vanuatu/entry-requirements  https://www.vanuatu.travel/en/index.php

There and no travel restrictions within Vanuatu, flights are operating between islands but frequency may be lower due to limited demand.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200909105411/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/vanuatu/coronavirus
